name: Wonder-reader
tagline: Comic Book Reader, written with Node and Electron
body: # Wonder-Reader Version 0.3.7 __Requirements__: Git, Node, and NPM or Yarn ## Downloads * Windows: [(link)](https://gitlab.com/alice-em/wonderReaderReleases/raw/master/Wonder%20Reader-win32-x64.zip) * OSX: [(link)](https://gitlab.com/alice-em/wonderReaderReleases/raw/master/Wonder%20Reader-darwin-x64.zip) * Linux: [(link)](https://gitlab.com/alice-em/wonderReaderReleases/raw/master/Wonder%20Reader-linux-x64.zip) * Note: `unrar` must be in `$PATH` for Linux users. ## Installation and Starting ```shell git clone https://github.com/alice-em/Wonder-Reader.git cd Wonder-Reader npm install npm start ``` ```shell git clone https://github.com/alice-em/Wonder-Reader.git cd Wonder-Reader yarn install yarn start ``` ## Compiling __Requirements__: electron-packager npm run packager or yarn run packager ## Development __Requirements__: Grunt-cli, Sass, and some sort of text-editor TODO: * Comics at either __firstPage__ or __lastPage__ can open up the next file in library folder. * Any other neat ideas that could work go here too. * Double click zoom in function! ## Credit * CSS Loaders :: https://github.com/lukehaas/css-loaders * Dragscroll.js :: https://github.com/asvd/dragscroll * Electron :: http://electron.atom.io * Font Awesome :: http://fontawesome.io/ * Node :: https://nodejs.org/en/ * Node Directory Tree :: https://github.com/mihneadb/node-directory-tree Logo by Jake Brockway : [website](http://jacobvbrockway.weebly.com)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
